metadata.title: CVE-2019-19067 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** Four memory leaks in the acp_hw_init() function indrivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/amdgpu_acp.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.8allow attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) bytriggering mfd_add_hotplug_devices() or pm_genpd_add_device() failures, akaCID-57be09c6e874. NOTE: third parties dispute the relevance of this becausethe attacker must already have privileges for module loading.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1096-azure - 4.15.0-1096.106~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1096.106~14.04.1').
